CITY OF CAMBRIDGE, MASSACHUSETTS

PLANNING BOARD
CITY HALL ANNEX, 344 BROADWAY, CAMBRIDGE, MA 02139

AGENDA
Tuesday, May 11, 2021 at 6:30 PM
Remote Meeting
Cambridge, Massachusetts
PLEASE NOTE: Due to statewide emergency orders limiting the size of public gatherings in response to COVID-19, this meeting will be held with
remote participation and closed to in-person attendance. Members of the public can view the meeting online or on cable television within
Cambridge, provide comments by 5:00 P.M. the day before the meeting to planningboardcomment@cambridgema.gov, and attend virtually
online or by telephone.
Register for Zoom Webinar to participate in real time (before or during the meeting):
https://cambridgema.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_7Rq5V5yZSGWPr-5YvpFQdg
Check your e-mail (including spam/junk folder) for confirmation.
If you do not have a computer or e-mail address, attend via phone:
Dial: 312-626-6799 or 929-436-2866 or 301-715-8592 or 346-248-7799 or 669-900-6833 or 253-215-8782
Webinar ID: 853 0022 9764
Review Information about Remote Planning Board Meetings:
www.cambridgema.gov/CDD/zoninganddevelopment/planningboard/remoteplanningboardmeetings
If you have questions about remote meetings, please call Swaathi Joseph at 617-349-4668.

General Business
Update from the Community Development Department
Adoption of Planning Board meeting transcripts (3/30/2021, 4/6/2021)

Public Hearings
6:30 p.m.
Missing Middle Housing Zoning Petition (continued from 3/30/2021)
Zoning petition by Carolyn Fuller, et. al. to amend the Zoning Map of the City of Cambridge to reclassify
all land currently in Residence A-1, Residence A-2, Residence B, Residence C, or Residence C-1 Districts
as being in a newly created Residence N District, and to amend Articles 3.000, 4.000, 5.000, 6.000, and
11.000 of the Zoning Ordinance by deleting provisions effective in the Residence A-1, Residence A-2,
Residence B, Residence C, and Residence C-1 Districts and creating use and dimensional requirements
applicable in the new Residence N District, and by deleting minimum off-street parking requirements for
nontransient residential uses, among other amendments. (Materials)
7:00 p.m.
Cannabis Delivery-Only Zoning Petition
Zoning petition by the City Council to amend Articles 2.000, 4.000 and 11.000 of the Zoning Ordinance of
the City of Cambridge to create new land use classifications and associated regulations for ‚ÄúCannabis
Courier Establishments‚Äù and ‚ÄúCannabis Delivery Operators‚Äù. (Materials)

General Business items may be taken out of the order in which they appear on the agenda above. Times for General Business items
are approximate. Public comments are taken only during a Public Hearing. During the discussion and deliberation on General
Business items, the Planning Board does not solicit public comment. The City of Cambridge will provide reasonable accommodations
to people with disabilities upon request. Please make requests for alternative formats at least two weeks in advance by contacting
the Planning Board staff listed below. For further information concerning this agenda, please contact Swaathi Joseph, Planning Board
staff, at 617 349 4668, sjoseph@cambridgema.gov. Applications and Petitions are online at www.cambridgema.iqm2.com.

Communication: Missing Middle Housing_20210511 (Public Hearings)

Packet Pg. 18

Communication: Cannabis Delivery_20210511 (Public Hearings)

City of Cambridge
Community Development Department

Cannabis Delivery
Zoning Petition
May 11, 2021

Packet Pg. 19

Packet Pg. 20

July 2, 2019

Community Development Department

2

Communication: Cannabis Delivery_20210511 (Public Hearings)

Background

Date

Action

2016

Massachusetts approves non-medical ("adult use") marijuana by ballot initiative

2018

City Council adopts Ordinance #1404 which sets forth local zoning regulations for adult-use
Cannabis Retail Stores and Cannabis Production Facilities

2019

City Council adopts Cannabis Business Permitting Ordinance which sets forth conditions for
business operation and helps promote economic empowerment and social justice objectives

Oct. 2020

City Council files zoning petition to allow Cannabis Delivery ‚Äì Planning Board makes positive
recommendation, suggests being less restrictive

Nov. 2020

Cannabis Control Commission (CCC) adopts amendments to state regulations enabling homedelivery of adult-use cannabis products

Dec. 2020

City Council requests staff develop new petition to be consistent with state regs. and to expand
allowable districts (submitted Mar. 2021)
Packet Pg. 21

May 11, 2021

Community Development Department

3

Communication: Cannabis Delivery_20210511 (Public Hearings)

Brief History of Cannabis Regulations in Cambridge

Packet Pg. 22

May 11, 2021

Community Development Department

4

Communication: Cannabis Delivery_20210511 (Public Hearings)

Zoning Petition

Cannabis Delivery
Operator Establishment
‚úì Can purchase wholesale
‚úì Warehouse on site
‚úì Sell directly to customers but
not from a storefront (no
sales permitted on-site)

Communication: Cannabis Delivery_20210511 (Public Hearings)

Two Types of Home Delivery Uses
Cannabis Courier
Establishment
‚úì Point of sale is at existing
approved adult-use retailer
(can collocate)
‚úì Fleet vehicles must be
parked on-site
‚úì Cannot sell directly to
customers
‚úì Similar to a dispatch
operation
Packet Pg. 23

May 11, 2021

Community Development Department

5

All office, business & industrial districts (as of
right)
All office, business & industrial districts (by
Planning Board Special Permit)

Cannabis Courier Establishment
Cannabis Delivery Operator Establishment
Use

Permitted Zoning Districts

Open
Space

Districts (A, B, C,
C-1, C-1A, C-2, C2A, C-2B, C-3, C3A, C-3B

Office
Districts (1,
2A, 2, 3,
3A)

Business
Districts (A-1,
A-2, A-3, A, A4, B, B-1, B-2,
C, C-1)

Industry A

Industry B-1,
B-2

Industry B

Industry C

Cannabis Retail
Stores (existing)

Buffers
Communication: Cannabis Delivery_20210511 (Public Hearings)

Cannabis Courier Establishment

None (no product on-site)

Cannabis Delivery Operator
Establishment

300‚Äô from schools and
parks/recreation areas

Packet Pg. 25

May 11, 2021

Community Development Department

7

Parking & Transportation

‚Ä¢ Low minimum parking
requirements (similar to light
industrial uses)
‚Ä¢ Room for on-site storage of fleet
vehicles

Communication: Cannabis Delivery_20210511 (Public Hearings)

Cannabis Courier Establishment

Cannabis Delivery
Operator Establishment
‚Ä¢ Low minimum parking
requirements (similar to light
industrial uses)
‚Ä¢ Logistics plan subject to review
and approval by TP&T and Police
Department

‚Ä¢ Logistics plan subject to review
and approval by TP&T and Police
Department (currently required
for Cannabis Retail Stores and
Cannabis Production Facilities)

Packet Pg. 26

May 11, 2021

Community Development Department

8

o Cannabis Courier Establishment
‚Ä¢ As-of-right but subject to the
requirements of Section 11.800 of the
CZO

o Cannabis Delivery Operator
Establishment
‚Ä¢ Requires Planning Board Special Permit
‚Ä¢ Criteria for approval include
access/loading, security, storefront
activity and service to medical
customers

Packet Pg. 27

May 11, 2021

2020 Income Limits

Community Development Department

9

Communication: Cannabis Delivery_20210511 (Public Hearings)

Review & Approval Process

‚Ä¢ Added new CCC definitions for Cannabis Courier
Establishment and Cannabis Delivery Operator
‚Ä¢ Added requirement for the submittal of the
operations and logistics plan for home-delivery
uses
‚Ä¢ Added that renewal of Cannabis Business
Permit conditioned upon no outstanding
violations of the CZO or TP&T regulations.

Packet Pg. 28

May 11, 2021

Community Development Department

10

Communication: Cannabis Delivery_20210511 (Public Hearings)

Changes to Cannabis Business
Permitting Ordinance

Potential Considerations

Cannabis Courier Establishment

Cannabis Delivery Operator Establishment

General Definition and
Characteristics

‚Ä¢No cannabis products on-site
‚Ä¢Includes office/dispatch area and parking spaces fo
r vehicle fleet
‚Ä¢Limited delivery hours, vehicles parked at facility
overnight

‚Ä¢Cannabis products on-site, but no customers on-site
‚Ä¢No processing/repackaging
‚Ä¢Includes warehouse/storage area for products and parking spaces for
vehicle fleet
‚Ä¢Limited delivery hours, loading activity regulations

Permitted Zoning Districts

‚Ä¢All Office
‚Ä¢All Business
‚Ä¢All Industry

‚Ä¢All Office
‚Ä¢All Business
‚Ä¢All Industry

Location Standards

‚Ä¢None additional

‚Ä¢300-foot buffer from schools and public parks/recreation (unless
reduced by Planning Board)

Parking/Transportation
Standards

‚Ä¢Low parking requirements typical of other light
industry
‚Ä¢Off-street parking required for fleet vehicles (not
waivable)
‚Ä¢Operations and Logistics plan approved by TP&T
and Police

‚Ä¢Low parking requirements typical of other light industry
‚Ä¢Off-street parking required for fleet vehicles (not waivable)
‚Ä¢Operations and Logistics plan approved by TP&T and Police

Review/Approval Process

‚Ä¢As-of-right
‚Ä¢Subject to standards in 11.800

‚Ä¢Planning Board special permit
‚Ä¢Criteria: access/egress, loading/service, aesthetic impacts of security
measures, storefront activity, service to medical customers

Local Non-Zoning Requirements

‚Ä¢Cannabis Business Permit
‚Ä¢Host Community Agreement

‚Ä¢Cannabis Business Permit
‚Ä¢Host Community Agreement
